name: Nick Anderson
description: Pete Hegseth loves to lecture the U.S. military about the “warrior ethos,” casting himself as the nation’s armchair Rambo-in-chief. But when it comes to real accountability—specifically for authorizing strikes on unarmed people clinging to boats in the Caribbean—his warrior bravado evaporates. The man who scolds soldiers about courage suddenly can’t muster an ounce of it himself. Instead, he hides behind talking points, evasions, and patriotic cosplay, proving once again that the loudest sermons about bravery often come from the safest seats in the house.
title: Accountability

name: Nick Anderson

name: Pedro X. Molina
description: From elementary school classrooms to the highest circles of power, it is a quasi-universal constant that the bullies who act the bravest, toughest, and most macho are the first to cower and try to dodge responsibility when confronted with the consequences of their actions. Pete Hegseth is no exception.
title: The screwer

name: Pedro X. Molina

title: The screwer

name: Rob Rogers
description: The illegal military strikes on Venezuelan boats by the U.S. military has landed Hegseth and Trump in hot water. Both men are cowardly trying to blame others for their war crimes.
title: Hegseth
